poem:
### In the Capital's Shadow

In a city of power,  
under the shadow of peace,  
a bullet breaks dialogue—  
two hearts silenced by hate.  

Their names echo,  
caught in a dance of politics.  
Yet beneath stars we sense  
the tangled root of sorrow,  
where justice falters,  
seeking not the end of life  
but the seed of its renewal.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
